etymology.description: 雨 (rain) + 伞/傘 (umbrella; parasol) = umbrella for rain.
etymology.interpretation: Literally “rain umbrella,” highlighting its use against rain rather than sun. Contrasts with 阳伞/太陽傘 for a sunshade.
etymology.simplification: 傘 was simplified to 伞 by reducing the pictographic strokes to a single canopy form; 雨 was unchanged.

examples.chinese: 他忘了带雨伞(他忘了帶雨傘)。
examples.english: He forgot to bring an umbrella.

examples.chinese: 下雨了(下雨了)，我们一起打伞(我們一起打傘)。
examples.pinyin: Xià yǔ le, wǒmen yìqǐ dǎ sǎn.
examples.english: It started raining, so we share an umbrella.

examples.chinese: 这把雨伞很结实(這把雨傘很結實)。
